definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
as far as possible/to do one's utmost
nothing is impossible/there's nothing impossible about it
pinyin: mei2 you3 shen2 me5 bu4 ke3 neng2

sentences.english: You’re probably one of those weirdos that doesn’t drink coffee in the morning either.
sentences.chinese: 而且你可能也是那種早晨不用喝咖啡的古怪人。

sentences.english: The nature of the stimulus may predispose some children to attention problems.
sentences.chinese: 刺激本身很可能使一些孩子易產生注意力問題。

sentences.english: Russia, a major oil producer, is unlikely to embrace any ambitious emissions reductions.
sentences.chinese: 產油大國俄羅斯不太可能歡迎任何大幅減排計劃。

sentences.english: We might even see-saw between both counterproductive poles.
sentences.chinese: 我們甚至可能看到雙方針鋒相對的情況。

sentences.english: Someone you least expect could be trying to make you look bad.
sentences.chinese: 有人可能會想讓你出醜，這個人是你意想不到的。

sentences.english: It is possible that you inadvertently took an excessive dose of an over-the-counter preparation.
sentences.chinese: 有可能是你把非處方藥喫過量了。

sentences.english: China's fertility rate may be much lower than official estimates.
sentences.chinese: 中國人口高增長率可能會比政府估計的要低很多。

sentences.english: I think the EDG probably uses a low astigmatism eyepiece design like the SE.
sentences.chinese: 我想EDG可能使用了象SE一樣的低像散目鏡設計。

sentences.english: Who would have thought a pansy could be such a naughty little flower.
sentences.chinese: 誰曾想到一三色堇可能是這樣一個頑皮的花。

sentences.english: And light multitaskers might be better at preserving their attention.
sentences.chinese: 並且輕度的一心多用者可能更擅長保持注意力。

sentences.english: We cannot rule out the possibility of mistaken identity.
sentences.chinese: 我們不能排除有認錯人的可能。

sentences.english: Do you think it's possible for me to change to a single room with a bath?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得我有可能換到一間有衛浴設備的單人房嗎？

sentences.english: In my life, I think to have a happy childhood is impassible.
sentences.chinese: 唉，我這輩子，是不可能有一個快樂的童年了。

sentences.english: But, if a man bites a dog, that might make front-page news.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果人咬了狗，那倒可能成爲頭版新聞。

sentences.english: China may soon make a big contribution to the bank's intellectual ranks.
sentences.chinese: 中國可能很快就會爲世行的學者隊伍作一個大貢獻。

definition: and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
